result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Lawrence Kaiser

records.addlTxt: Filed by attorney Purnell
Defendant did not stop to sign amended bail sheet. Clerk emailed bail sheet to counsel requesting signature.
proposed order sent to B2 Jdash

No contact with victims, no contact with RW, MLRW, KAW, not enter residence or go within 500 ft of residence. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.  No contact with any child under the age of 18 years.

11:24 AM Defendant Andrew Lawrence Kaiser appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran, appearing as a friend of the Court.  Attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court finds probable cause. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Court will provide form for Court appointed counsel, should defendant need form.
